CatDescriptText: Mrs. Jeannette Henderson, 4500 Sylvan Avenue, Hazelwood, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 19, 1958, pg. 9 with question: "Do you think that a business recession has hit the United States? If so, how has it affected you?" answer reads: "I don't think that it has hit too hard.  And most of the thanks can go to a guy named Roosevelt who set up the social security program.  Before when there were hard times, there wasn't anything coming in.  I work for the State and therefore have not been hurt by the hard time."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Jeannette Henderson wearing dark satin striped dress with matching brooches, standing on Market Street with Diamond Market in background, Downtown
